author: Pippa Bailey
title: 10 teacups and saucers - Food & Drink
text:
It's National Afternoon Tea Week — any excuse for a cup of English Breakfast —so we've been scouring the shops to find beautiful, design-led receptacles, for your spread, without a hint of vintage/mismatched/florals (delete as appropriate) in sight.
1. Hoganas Tea Cup and Saucer: £15, royaldesign.co.uk
This clean, simple Scandi cup is also available in red, white and matt dark grey and comes with a contrasting oak wood saucer, which doubles as a lid.
Buy now
2. 1660 London Tea Cups and Saucers: £75 for two, amara.com
The tea-dedicated brand’s range of tasting cups are designed by a tea connoisseur-ceramicist duo to enhance your drinking experience. Made for black tea, this one is designed to bring out earthy flavours and give a subtle scent, but we love it for the luxe saucer.
Buy now
3. Terrier Tea Cup and Saucer: £15, sophieallport.com
A slightly more traditional design, this sweet little (it’s just 7.8cm tall) bone china cup from illustrator Sophie Allport is homely without being twee. It has a tiny terrier on the front and back and inside the lip.
Buy now
4. Design House Stockholm Blond Cup and Saucer: £21, houseology.com
The Blond dinnerware range is designed by Reliefgruppen, a collective formed by Sweden’s first professor of ceramics. The bobbled bone china cup, with a smooth saucer, is a pleasingly tactile twist on a simple design.
Buy now
5. Kinto Fika Café Sweets Yellow Cup and Wooden Plate: £22.95, homearama.co.uk
It may be called “Fika”, the Swedish for taking a coffee break, but this combo hails from Japan. The off- set saucer provides the perfect space for a biscuit, and also comes in a bigger version. Choose from this yellow, red, green or glass.
Buy now
6. Seletti I-Wares Porcelain Tea Set: £25, madeindesign.co.uk
This fanciful, baroque-style cup from the Italian brand wouldn’t look out of place on the Mad Hatter’s tea table. We love the fluorescent orange handle (also available in blue, green, pink and yellow) and the matching porcelain spoon.
Buy now
7. Jansen + Co Loop Tea Cup and Saucer: £19.50, monologuelondon.com
We love the bold colour palette and sleek yet solid build of all the Dutch brand’s tableware, but this two- tone porcelain cup and saucer is a favourite. The unusual shape – it’s 16cm wide and just 6cm deep – may lead to a few spills before you get used to it, but it looks beautiful.
Buy now
8. Lindsey Busby Designs Street Scene Cup and Saucer: £18, notonthehighstreet.com
Illustrator Lindsey Busby designs with a combination of freehand machine embroidery and painting, which is then transferred onto bone china. The terraced houses on this cup have tiny coloured doors and window boxes.
Buy now
9. Royal Doulton 1815 Blue Cup and Saucer: £9, houseoffraser.co.uk
This simple porcelain set is part of a range designed to commemorate the fine pottery company’s 200- year birthday. The contrast of white and blue glaze is subtle but modern.
Buy now
10. Doubled Walled Cup and Saucer Set: £9.50, marksandspencer.com
In a style more commonly found on coffee cups in European cafés, these have two layers of glass to keep your tea warm for longer. The insulation also makes for a great- looking cup, which are at their best displaying a fresh herbal tea.
Buy now
Verdict:
For looks alone, we'd choose Design House 's textured cup or Hoganas' simple Scandi design, but for great design at a bargain price, Royal Doulton 's 1815 is our favourite.
